Text: It is a difficult task to stand up to your boss and to take on corporate greed in your workplace, but workers in West Virginia, in Alabama, in California, and all over this country are leading that fight. https://t.co/x0SszXmnLW

In the 1950s, CEOs made about 20x more than the average worker.

In the 1980s, CEOs made about 40x more than the average worker.

Today, the CEOs of this country are making 350x more than what the average worker makes.
The average worker, when adjusting for inflation, is making $44 a week LESS today than they made in the 1970's.

I have been told that bold action to avert the climate crisis is 'too expensive,' or that it's 'too radical.'

I am once again asking, when 40% of our people live somewhere that has experienced a climate-related disaster in just the last year, what is the alternative? https://t.co/nlKrsZbr4p
Our democracy is under severe attack. My statement on January 6th. https://t.co/oq0KDXKrvX

What is the meaning of solidarity? I believe it means that nobody wants to be alone in this world. The idea that you can stand together with your fellow workers on the job and demand dignity — that is essential. https://t.co/PNsXQDXlmX

"How you can sleep at night when you have $7 billion and you want to take a $300 a month health plan from a kid in West Virginia, or Alabama, or California — I can't explain that." - Chad Thompson, @steelworkers Local 40 https://t.co/Ad5XMOF2qV

"It seems to me that companies are going to a turnover workforce — they don't have to give you the benefits if you're only going to be there for a short period of time. With a union, we set out to make it a career instead of a job." - Braxton Wright, @MineWorkers Local 2368 https://t.co/ITQEjZCVuu

"As of January 1st, we no longer have medical insurance." - Cristina Luján, @BCTGM 37

These workers are now going without health insurance in the middle of a terrible pandemic. This sort of corporate greed is totally unacceptable. https://t.co/cddvu6QqFx

How do workers feel about a company owned by one of the richest guys on the planet cutting health care benefits and workers' pensions?
"I don't think he's on everybody's Christmas card list."  - Chad Thompson, @steelworkers Local 40 https://t.co/nPM4TXfny1

"Being on strike as long as we have, it's a real challenge. It's really hard on families to go through Christmas with the uncertainty of not knowing if you're going to be able to provide for your family." - Chad Thompson, @steelworkers Local 40 https://t.co/iUy7eI4MGJ

NOW: Workers are standing up to some of the most powerful corporate interests in the country. We’re talking LIVE with workers in Alabama, California and West Virginia about their strikes for justice. 

https://t.co/QrS48A66Xd

The Gilded Age is not ancient history — the average American worker produces far more today than they did decades ago, yet that worker is worse off economically than they were in 1973. https://t.co/D9HVAMy59p
LIVE NOW: Working people all over the country are taking on corporate greed and winning. In 2022, we must stand together in unprecedented solidarity. https://t.co/QrS48zOvyD

While the corporate-owned media may not be talking about it, working people all over the country are taking on corporate greed, and guess what? They're winning.

Join me tonight at 8 PM ET at https://t.co/vreIiWfeoS for a livestream discussion with striking workers. https://t.co/GJ3EVbwNFn

The wealthy and powerful corporate interests are trying to create a culture that makes us feel weak and hopeless and diminishes the strength of human solidarity. No. Despair is not an option. Instead, we must rise up together.

At a time of massive income and wealth inequality working people, with great courage, are standing together against corporate greed. Their struggle is our collective struggle. 

Join me and striking workers for a livestream discussion tomorrow night at 8 PM ET. https://t.co/uLpb1oGhye

Against overwhelming odds, the men and women of the labor movement changed society for the better. If you've ever enjoyed a paid vacation, a weekend off, a sick day, or a pension, the labor movement — not your boss — are the people to thank.
Tax the billionaires. https://t.co/MbBVQmwiv5

Let's be clear. Class warfare in this country is intensifying. The ruling class is united, and they are united in greed.

No one individual is going to save us. We must rise up together. Our greatest weapon in these times is our solidarity. https://t.co/HUU8hOipIi

2022 is the year of solidarity. Working people all over the country — with extraordinary courage and determination — are taking on corporate greed, and they're winning.

Join me and striking workers for a town hall this Wednesday night at 8 PM ET. https://t.co/om1MmTlHNz

The American Rescue Plan reduced childhood poverty in America by over 40% through the expanded child tax credit. It helped millions of families to survive. Unless Build Back Better is passed, the expansion will end and we will see a huge increase in childhood poverty. https://t.co/on2c71b3oP

It's not easy to stand up to your boss and say, 'you know what? I'm a human being, I have rights, I deserve to be treated with respect and dignity.' But all over this country, you're seeing workers standing up, organizing, and fighting back. Solidarity — that's how you win power.

If you believe, as I do, that at a time of massive inequality the key to creating an economy that works for all, not just the few, requires a resurgent labor movement, then we must expose corporate greed, support striking workers and make it easier for people to join a union.

Jane and I want to take this opportunity to wish you and yours a safe and healthy new year. 2022 is not a time for despair or cynicism. Now is a time for hard work. Now is a time to stand up and fight for the country that we know we can become.

Warren Buffett is a billionaire worth over $100 BILLION with a tax rate of just 0.10%. He's spoken eloquently on the crisis of growing inequality. But why doesn't he want to make sure the steelworkers of Special Metals are treated with dignity and respect? https://t.co/N5aJqXkqOK

It was nearly 70° in Alaska just a few days ago.
Cities in Colorado are overrun with wildfire and hundred mile-per-hour winds.

Anyone who denies that we are in the midst of a large-scale climate crisis is not living in reality.

We need bold climate action and we need it now.

Mr. Buffett is one of the wealthiest guys on the planet. There is no reason that steelworkers at Special Metals, a W.V. company that made $1.5 billion in profits last year, should accept an insulting contract that includes significant pay cuts and major cuts to their health care. https://t.co/bWQsOupPDs

Billionaires spending millions of dollars on political campaigns while Republicans in state after state make it harder and harder to vote is not a democracy. It is a corrupt political system controlled by a small group of people that Congress must have the guts to take on.

It's true that corporate profits have never been higher. And still, they want more.

But there is another more important truth: there are a lot more of us than there are of them. Now is the time to organize. Now is the time to end their greed.

For the ruling class, greed is a religion. They will cut back on workers' wages, on workers' benefits, on workers' safety on the job — all for the sake of having more, more, more.

I've got news for the ruling class: you cannot have it all. The working class is fighting back.

18 million Americans have gone without filling a prescription from their doctor because they could not afford the cost. Let me repeat that. 1 in 10 people in America today are going without the medicine they've been prescribed because of the cost. That, to me, is an outrage.
A nurse should not pay more in federal taxes than Amazon owner Jeff Bezos, who is worth $195 billion.

CEOs now make over 350 times as much as their average employees as they receive large salaries, stock options, "golden parachutes" and a wide range of perks. It is time they understand they cannot have it all.

If a CEO offers a member of Congress $5 to vote for a bill, it's considered a bribe – subject to severe punishment. If a CEO starts a Super-PAC, and raises millions for that member, it is perfectly legal. We must overturn Citizens United and move to public funding of elections.
In the richest country in the history of the world, you should not have to work 2 or 3 jobs just to put food on the table and keep a roof over your head.
You wanna organize and join a labor union? You should be able to do so without intimidation from your boss. That doesn't seem like too radical an idea to me.

In the midst of this pandemic we thank our overworked doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals for all they are doing. Working within a dysfunctional health care system, their dedication and courage has saved thousands of lives. We very much appreciate their sacrifices.

Jane and I wish you and yours a very safe and merry Christmas. I am absolutely confident that, as we stand together, we will defeat this pandemic and move our country and world forward toward peace, justice and environmental sanity. Keep the faith.
It was the labor movement that brought you the holiday weekend.
The Democratic Party must once again become the party that stands up for the working class of this country.

The Build Back Better Act is a bold attempt to finally address the long-neglected needs of working families and demand that the wealthiest people in this country and large corporations start paying their fair share.

It's time to take a vote in the Senate.
https://t.co/6h68xVAQMG

No, getting an education should not mean that you are burdened for life with student loan debt.

Yes, the time is now to cancel all $1.86 trillion of student debt in this country.
In this country, we allow the pharmaceutical industry's greed to go totally unchecked, leaving the American people to pay ten times more for insulin than the people of Canada. That is a disgrace.

I voted against NAFTA.
I voted against PNTR with China.

It was obvious to me then, and it is obvious to me now that what these large corporations want is to pay desperate people in other countries a buck an hour instead of paying workers in America decent wages. https://t.co/SO6VJ1vxqX

Last year, while nearly 1 out of 4 Americans could not afford to fill the prescriptions written by their doctors, 6 of the largest drug companies made tens of billions in profits. That is absolutely insane.

The time to take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry is now.

We cannot be negotiating forever while standing for nothing.

Let's bring the Build Back Better Act to the floor of the Senate and finally have the guts to take on the most powerful special interests in the country. https://t.co/eesYSIxNRS

I suspect that the people of WV are like people in every other state.

They want to lower prescription drug costs.
They want Medicare to cover vision, hearing and dental.
They want to continue $300 per child monthly payments.
They want the wealthy to pay their fair share. https://t.co/AydhMohrQi

We have more income and wealth inequality in America today than at any time in history.
The corporate elite basically own many parts of the Congress.

If you think Reconstruction is ancient history and its lessons are not relevant to today, you are missing a very important point. https://t.co/WJoa37QZ9Y

"Slavery was a total institution — a system of labor, of politics, of race relations. When slavery was gone, what was to replace it?" - Professor Eric Foner on the class struggles that took place after the abolition of slavery https://t.co/5szvFW6SyW

"Part of the problem of our present moment of such moral decay and spiritual decrepitude is too much conformity, too much complacency, too much complicity, and too much cowardliness." - @CornelWest https://t.co/9G13SavoAG

"There's always a temptation in U.S. politics when discussing American history to imagine the nation's history as inherently progressive... History is not promised or inevitable. It is always a product of struggle." - Professor @KeeangaYamahtta https://t.co/lCS2X0RZWG
"How we think about this history matters today. It's not just an academic exercise." - Professor Eric Foner on the crucial need to learn from the history of Reconstruction https://t.co/O70L8LrQ4X
LIVE NOW: Join me, Professor Eric Foner, @KeeangaYamahtta, and @CornelWest for an important discussion on the lessons of Reconstruction. https://t.co/hHE5DYF37u

My message to Kellogg's is this.

You don't treat people whose families gave their lives to your company as disposable. You don't threaten to send their jobs to Mexico.

You treat them with the dignity and the respect that they deserve. https://t.co/fYEZLLn22R

If Joe Manchin does not have the guts to stand up to the powerful special interests, he's going to have to explain that to the people of West Virginia who are hurting and hurting badly. https://t.co/U5OeNlk6ea

TOMORROW, 8PM ET: Join me, Professor Eric Foner, @KeeangaYamahtta, and @CornelWest for an important panel discussion on the lessons of Reconstruction. 

Watch LIVE at https://t.co/vreIiWfeoS. https://t.co/1sIqNIEhJe
Any worker in any state in this country who wants to join a labor union must be allowed to do so.
Here’s the letter from President Biden that I read at today’s rally with striking Kellogg’s workers in Battle Creek, Michigan. https://t.co/7rftfPqvr2
All across this country, working people are saying: "Enough is enough. We want dignity. We want respect. We want justice." https://t.co/3ilAMxkEbF

Working people in this country want dignity.
They want respect.
They want to be able to raise their families with a decent middle-class income.
And they don't want to have to work 100 days in a row to be able to do that. https://t.co/RxapgVdW8q

I want the American people to know this. When you look at Kellogg's workers, you're looking at people who have worked 60, 70, or 100 hours a week to feed this country without a day off.

You don't treat those workers with disrespect and contempt. https://t.co/SaWLvLTVID

I've got a message for Kellogg's.

If you love America, then you love the workers of this country.

And if you love American workers, you don't threaten them with permanent replacements, or to ship their jobs to desperate people in Mexico to pay them 90 cents an hour. https://t.co/AMR9LP5SPY

What's going on in this country right now is a disgrace.

We are seeing massive levels of massive income and wealth inequality. Working people are struggling to put food on the table. But the top 1%, they're doing just fine. Does that sound acceptable to you? https://t.co/KCbg6EUCCk
"What we're here to do is to stop the exploitation of the American middle-class worker." - Trevor Bidelman, BCTGM Local 3G President https://t.co/NrmqPxP3ac

"Everyone is sick and tired of working every single waking moment of their life. We have to do this just to have some version of what's referred to as a 'comfortable living.'" - Trevor Bidelman, BCTGM Local 3G President https://t.co/BorYuoz7Ws

END KELLOGG'S GREED: I'm in Battle Creek, Michigan standing with striking workers who are demanding dignity on the job and an end to Kellogg's corporate greed. Join us LIVE now. https://t.co/hvoIdGk6bc

Kellogg's is a company that made $1.4 billion in profit last year.
They can afford to compensate their CEO to the tune of nearly $12 million.

And how did they make that money? The workers who came to work during a pandemic and fed this country. Those workers deserve our support. https://t.co/O5YbL4vmAx

I don't know how you look at Kellogg's, who is raking in BILLIONS in profits on the backs of workers doing 12-hour shifts for 100 days in a row and say that those workers do not deserve decent wages, decent working conditions, and dignity on the job. Not a radical idea!

I look forward to standing with striking Kellogg's workers today in Battle Creek, Michigan. These workers have tremendous courage in not only standing up for themselves, but for future generations against the reckless corporate greed on display by Kellogg's.

Join us at 3 PM ET. https://t.co/i8Eojd2vmb

On Sunday night, we will hold a very important livestream discussion about the lessons of Reconstruction. 

Please join me and our special guests Professor Eric Foner, @KeeangaYamahtta, and @CornelWest at 8 PM ET at https://t.co/vreIiWfeoS. https://t.co/mLL9UDAqM7

Last year, the Kellogg's workers helping to feed America during a global pandemic were rightly considered "heroes."

Today, the company considers them to be disposable. I stand in solidarity with the workers in their struggle for respect and dignity.
https://t.co/RU2wwQ3clP

I've been told that radical action to avert the climate crisis is "unrealistic." I disagree.

What's truly unrealistic is continuing to do nothing and expecting our planet to be remotely inhabitable for future generations.

NOW is the time to act.

Kellogg's workers kept the country fed during a global pandemic, bringing Kellogg's BILLIONS in profits.

Can Kellogg's afford to negotiate in good faith with the workers demanding dignity? Absolutely.

This Friday, I'm headed to Michigan to stand with the workers. Join me. https://t.co/FQxexyeHmg

As part of the American Rescue Plan, the expanded Child Tax Credit helped cut child poverty in HALF.

Let’s be clear, anyone who opposes its extension should come forward and explain to the American people why they think struggling working families don’t need help.

Despite receiving billions from taxpayers to develop the vaccines, drug companies remain more interested in increasing their profits than in saving lives. But let us be very clear. That taxpayer investment was not to make more money for drug companies. It was to crush COVID.

It wasn't the CEO or other executives that kept Kellogg's running and made them billions in profits during a global pandemic — it was the workers putting in 12-hour shifts for a breathtaking number of days in a row. Kellogg's must come to the table and negotiate in good faith.

Kellogg's workers made the company BILLIONS during a pandemic by working 12-hour shifts, some for more than 100 days in a row. But Kellogg's is now choosing corporate greed over the workers they once called “heroes.”

On Friday, I’m going to Michigan to stand with the workers. https://t.co/aJftYweFAN
You should not have to work 80 hours a week to make ends meet in this country.

Kellogg's workers came to work during the pandemic.
They worked 12-hour shifts.
They worked 7 days a week.
Kellogg's made $1.26 BILLION in profits last year.
Their CEO made over $11 million.

Don't you think workers deserve a contract that treats them with dignity and respect?

New moms in Denmark are guaranteed 126 days of paid leave to spend with their newborn.
New moms in Canada are guaranteed 119 days.
New moms in France are guaranteed 112 days.

New moms in the United States are guaranteed ZERO days.

Let's end this international embarrassment.

Kellogg's is a company that is worth tens of billions of dollars. They paid their CEO over $11 million last year.

So why are they threatening to fire striking workers and send jobs to Mexico that pay $0.97 an hour? The answer is greed. 

Let's stand with the workers. https://t.co/U9K71BPkEl

The tornado destruction in Kentucky, Arkansas, Illinois, Missouri, Mississippi and Tennessee is devastating. Jane and I send our deepest condolences to the families who lost loved ones and we thank the first responders working around the clock to save lives.

President Biden is exactly right. We cannot allow a large, profitable corporation to permanently replace striking workers and send their jobs to Mexico. Now is the time for our government to stand with struggling workers, and not with a greedy corporation. https://t.co/LoqpLUlvaZ
🎥 : @NoahRiffe

Stacie Hartman is a Marine veteran and a striking Kellogg’s worker who has worked 62 days in a row, mostly 12 hour days. But that's not enough for the Kellogg's CEO. He wants to ship her job to Mexico where he pays workers $0.97/hour. Support the workers. https://t.co/5G6nwlicHZ

There should be no doubt that abortion rights in this country are under relentless attack by far-right politicians.

If we are going to protect a woman's right to control her own body, we must reform the filibuster and codify Roe v. Wade into law with 50 votes in the Senate.

You're a billionaire — great, good for you. You want to zoom around on a rocket and pretend you're an astronaut? That's fine, it's a free country. But don't ask for government subsidies to do it and then whine when you're asked to pay your fair share of taxes.

Workers with @SBWorkersUnited made history today. They are a tremendous inspiration and it is so encouraging to see people all over the country standing up for themselves and each other. In solidarity, together, working people can achieve the dignity they deserve. https://t.co/FYlo3YPJr1

Congratulations to @SBWorkersUnited on the HISTORIC achievement of organizing the first-ever union at a company-owned Starbucks in the US. The company should stop pouring money into the fight against the union and negotiate a fair contract now. https://t.co/yNiXOjzy2v

Is Kellogg's facing hard times? No, not by a long shot. Over the course of the pandemic, they've made big profits. Their CEO makes millions. So, what could possibly be their justification for refusing to treat their workers with basic dignity?

It's GREED! https://t.co/Hr4kf6tacn

When Kellogg's employees worked 7 days a week during the pandemic to feed America they were called "heroes." Today, despite big profits, the company is trying to break their strike by bringing in permanent replacements and sending 275 jobs to Mexico. Let's stand with the workers.

Take a look around you.

1 out of 4 people can't afford the cost of their prescriptions.

All the while, billionaires have increased their wealth by more than $2 TRILLION since the start of the pandemic.

Don't you think it's time we got our national priorities straight?

Ask yourselves.

Why are Republicans so interested in making it harder and harder to vote in this country?

Why are businesses so keen on making it as difficult as possible for workers to form a union?

It's simple — it's all about taking power away from working people. No more.

The motivation of the pharmaceutical industry is greed — they squeeze the American people tighter and tighter to make themselves richer and richer — all while 1 out of 4 Americans can't afford the medicines their doctors prescribe.

It's time to end their greed.

How insane is it that in America today, for 1 out of 4 people in this country, this is the reality:

You get sick.
You go to the doctor.
The doctor writes a prescription.
You can't afford that medicine.

And what happens? In many cases, they get even sicker. Unacceptable.

The workers who are working so very hard to organize, who are standing up and fighting for justice are an enormous inspiration to me, and a reminder that if we stand together, there is nothing we cannot accomplish.

Not me, us. https://t.co/ix78Q5yLsH
It is my view that if a worker wants to join a union, it is his or her constitutional right to be able to do so. https://t.co/UoppO0i2IL
"We would already have our union if the laws didn't have so many loopholes that allowed corporate to come in and dominate us, delay efforts, and harass us." - Michelle Eisen https://t.co/9FwGg3XlxZ

"Howard Schultz and every other member of the upper chain of command could have chosen to make it easier on our baristas, to make it livable, and to avoid the challenges that came with the pandemic, but they chose not to. They chose virtue signaling." - Gianna Reeve https://t.co/4Y2HtactxJ
